question1.question: How do you start prototyping for a mobile app design?
question1.answer: You can start prototyping by simply sketching out rough ideas or directly using digital wireframing tools. It’s important to focus on the functionality and user-friendly approach of the application.

question2.question: Why is prototyping important when designing mobile apps?
question2.answer: Prototyping helps you improve design iterations. Once you’ve completed the prototype, every included person can agree on the app’s flow and the basic functionality of the application. Once it’s decided, you can focus on polishing the mobile app UI prototype with colors and other design aspects rather than doing back and forth for the Basic functionality.

question3.question: What’s the most vital thing to look for when prototyping?
question3.answer: The most vital thing while prototyping is, without a doubt, user experience. In other words, when someone opens the app, it should take them few seconds to figure out the app, rather than using how-to guides.

question4.question: What are the 4 main qualities of prototype?
question4.answer:
Representation: As mentioned earlier, the role of a prototype is to act as a mock-up of a design.
                Precision: A good prototype should also be highly precise.
                Functionality: Additionally, a good prototype should be highly functional.
                Improvising: A good prototype can be improvised with the least amount of effort.

question5.question: Why is prototyping important?
question5.answer: Prototyping makes it possible to concertize an idea and to understand which aspects of the idea prove difficult or impossible to implement. Making a prototype can thus highlight unanticipated physical, technical or financial constraints.

question2.question: What is Digital Marketing?
question2.answer: Digital marketing is the component of marketing that uses the Internet and online based digital technologies such as desktop computers, mobile phones and other digital media and platforms to promote products and services

question3.question: What sorts of businesses do you work with?
question3.answer: We have experience with and work with businesses of all sizes, from local companies and start-ups to national and multinational brands. We have experience of working with companies in all sorts of sectors, from software companies and insurers to local plumbers and photographers.

question4.question: How much do you charge?
question4.answer:
All our projects are completely bespoke, so it is difficult to give exact figures. At the moment we work with companies who have budgets per month. Rather than having a minimum amount, we adjust our strategies, volume of work and timescales based on the available budget.

                We can also adjust the approach we take depending on how much involvement our clients have. If you are happy to implement suggestions yourself (after a proper explanation), it will reduce the overall project cost.
                
                Furthermore, if you have a service we may have use for, we are happy to trade skills if possible.

question5.question: Can you guarantee results?
question5.answer:
Nobody can guarantee results in digital marketing as there are too many variables, especially with SEO, as Google’s algorithm is a secret. What we can do is point to a highly successful track record across all sorts of sectors and put you in contact with some of our clients if you want to see the kind of results we can produce.

                Also, trust us when we tell you that we aren’t happy with results unless you are!

question6.question: How will you report and how do we know what you'll be working on?
question6.answer:
We like to keep our clients up-to-date. We send monthly reports outlining performance, as well as work completed and upcoming work. In addition, we will also show you how to use Analytics and set up appropriate dashboards so you can keep track of performance yourselves.

question1.question: Why Should I Go for SEO Services?
question1.answer: Living in a world where more than 80% users search for a product or service online, having a web presence has become indispensable. If your business gets first page rankings, this means your future customers more trust and likely to buy from you. At ScriptoSoft , our aim is to help you fetch top spots on search engines for your target keywords.

question2.question: What Services are offered in SEO Package?
question2.answer: That completely depends on the current status of the website, the keywords you are trying to rank for among major factors. We will create a customized package depending on your requirements and the level of SEO required to propel your website to the top of search engine rankings. We are not a money minting SEO business, so you can expect complete transparency from our side.

question3.question: Can You Help Me with Local SEO?
question3.answer: Definitely. Local SEO is our forte and we have helped multiple local businesses acquire top positions on local search engines. We encourage you to discuss your local SEO needs in detail and we are more than happy to help.

question4.question: What are the different types of SEO?
question4.answer:
There are three different types of SEO
                On-page SEO – On-page or on-site SEO includes practical strategies for optimizing a single page on a website and improving a website's ranking and gaining organic traffic.
                Off-page SEO – This process also refers to techniques for improving a website's position on the search engine results page (SERP).
                Technical SEO – Technical SEO is the process of optimizing a website for crawling and indexing and helps search engines access, crawl, interpret and index the website in an easy way.

question5.question: What is a backlink?
question5.answer: All inbound links to a website or web page are known as back links. High-quality backlinks help web pages rank and have better search engine visibility.

question6.question: What is a keyword?
question6.answer: SEO keywords are words and phrases in web content that allow people to find a site via search engines.

question7.question: How can I do SEO for my website?
question7.answer: SEO is not a one-time activity, rather it is an ongoing process to maintain optimal visibility of your website on search engines like Google. It costs time and money. If you are short on time, the SEO agency can help you optimize your website.

question8.question: What is SEO in digital marketing?
question8.answer: SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization. It is the process of getting organic or free traffic to your website through search engines. It helps improve the quality and quantity of traffic on your website. SEO is mainly divided into 2 types: on-page SEO and off-page SEO.

question9.question: Is doing SEO important?
question9.answer: Whenever the user searches for a query, search engines process millions of pages before displaying the results. According to a study, 75% of people won't even go to the second page of search results. So, if your website is not optimized for SEO, it will be difficult to rank in the top results and you will lose quality traffic that could be your potential customers.

question1.question: What is Search Engine Marketing (SEM)?
question1.answer: SEM is a form of Internet Marketing that promotes websites by increasing website visibility in the search engines. It includes many activities like Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Local SEO, Pay-Per-Click (PPC) advertising, Social Media Marketing (SMM), visitor analysis and more.

question2.question: How does Search Engine Marketing help my business?
question2.answer:
If you have a business, your internet presence is the most important business tool you have working for you 24/7. Search Engine Marketing benefits your business by:

                Increased sales for your eCommerce site,
                Increased leads to your professional services business,
                Increased numbers of visitors to your brick-and-mortar business,
                Increasing whatever action you want the Internet visitor to take.

question3.question: I have a small business in a specific geographic area, can PPC advertising bring me business?
question3.answer: Absolutely. A PPC advertising campaign can be geographically targeted to specific locations and regions. Geo-targeting is well suited for brick-and-mortar stores and service businesses operating within a specific region, for instance real estate agencies and other professional services. Your PPC ads show only to those within the geographic area that are setup within the campaign. As with a local newspaper, you are only advertising to the target audience who is likely to use your service or buy your product.

question4.question: Can you guarantee me a #1 position in Google?
question4.answer: No, we can't guarantee a #1 organic spot and beware of anyone that does. There are over 200 factors that affect search engine results placement, including such things as location, longevity of site, quality of inbound links, the competitiveness of the market and many many more. We target the best keywords for your business and use strategies to get you on the first page. First page real estate can also be taken with local search results and Pay-Per-Click (PPC) advertisements, with proper optimization and advertising.

question5.question: How can a SEO / SEM audit help my business?
question5.answer:
A SEO / SEM Audit helps you to answer the following questions:

                Who is visiting my website and where are they geographically located?
                What search terms or referral sites did visitors use to find the business?
                Am I missing an audience on the internet that might want to buy my products or services?
                How can my website rank higher in the search engines, like the “top 3″ (Google, Yahoo, Bing)?
                Are there any websites or directories that my site should be listed in to generate referral traffic?
                How can my Pay-Per-Click (PPC) campaign get a higher click-thru-rate (CTR)? A higher conversion rate? Are there ways to lower the cost-per-click (CPC)?
                Are there search engine marketing opportunities that I am missing for my business because I don’t know the questions to ask?

question1.question: What is social media marketing promotion?
question1.answer: Social media promotion refers to branding various social media platforms to showcase your offerings to a global audience. It lets you promote your brand for free. You can employ sponsored ads at a low cost to widen your branding reach.

question2.question: Why is social media good for promotion?
question2.answer: Social media is good for promotion because of its large user base. More than half of the world's population is already on social media. Hence, reaching out to the audience becomes incredibly easy. With the help of personalization and targeting strategies, you can get in touch with potential customers and increase your revenue

question3.question: Which social media is best for promotion?
question3.answer: Your promotion on social media largely depends on your business type. If your target audience is younger demographics, then Instagram, TikTok, and Snapchat would be ideal for you. On the other hand, if your audience consists of working adults and senior professionals, LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter are best for your social media promotion.

question4.question: What is the role of social media in promotion?
question4.answer: Social media plays a vital role in promotion. For example, a new website visitor would like to visit your social media handle to check out your followers and valuable testimonials before purchasing. Social media provides social proof of your brand loyalty and boosts your awareness of your quality service.

question5.question: What are some of the important social media marketing tools?
question5.answer:
Some of the vital social media marketing tools are as follows:

                Content curation tools
                Social media listening tools
                Image and video editing tools
                Social media scheduling tools
                Customer relationship management tools
